rows.label: GLOSSARY_001_TITLE
rows.name: [ST:playername ]

rows.label: GLOSSARY_001_PAGE01
rows.name:
Rescued by Elma at Meteor Valley, this human survived
a dire crash landing after their Lifepod was jettisoned from
the White Whale during its fateful descent.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_001_PAGE02
rows.name:
To their misfortune, they have suffered memory loss and
are unable to recall anything but their name.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_002_TITLE
rows.name: Elma

rows.label: GLOSSARY_002_PAGE01
rows.name:
Leader of a team within BLADE, a paramilitary group. Rational
and level-headed, her attention to detail and sound judgment
have earned her great respect among her subordinates.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_003_TITLE
rows.name: Elma (True Form)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_003_PAGE01
rows.name:
Elma was revealed to be a xenoform who visited Earth thirty
years ago in the hope of saving humanity from war between
a Growth-led interstellar federation and another alien race.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_003_PAGE02
rows.name:
Technological marvels such as Dolls, arks capable of
faster-than-light travel, Blue Bloods and even the Lifepoint
are all based on extraterrestrial science provided by Elma.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_004_TITLE
rows.name: Lin

rows.label: GLOSSARY_004_PAGE01
rows.name:
Something of a child prodigy, Lin's engineering expertise
and contributions to Doll development have made her
indispensable to Elma's team in her role as chief mechanic.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_005_TITLE
rows.name: Tatsu

rows.label: GLOSSARY_005_PAGE01
rows.name:
An adolescent male Nopon, member of a species indigenous
to Mira. After being freed from Bias captivity by Elma's team,
Tatsu chose to join the team of his own accord.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_006_TITLE
rows.name: Irina

rows.label: GLOSSARY_006_PAGE01
rows.name:
A BLADE operative from the Interceptors Union. Despite her
no-nonsense personality, Irina shows great compassion for
Mira's inhabitants and considers it her duty to protect them.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_007_TITLE
rows.name: Gwin

rows.label: GLOSSARY_007_PAGE01
rows.name:
A BLADE operative from the Interceptors Union. Gwin looks
up to his commanding officer Irina and devotes himself to
constant training in the hope that he might one day be able

rows.label: GLOSSARY_007_PAGE02
rows.name:
to protect her, though a lack of ability has prevented him from
fully realizing this noble goal thus far.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_008_TITLE
rows.name: Doug

rows.label: GLOSSARY_008_PAGE01
rows.name:
A BLADE operative from the Avalanchers Union.
As a fighter, Doug is a proficient all-rounder, but shines
particularly brightly when seated in the cockpit of a Doll.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_008_PAGE02
rows.name:
Back on Earth, he served under Elma as part of the Coalition
forces' Special Operations Heavy Armor Training Unit (aka
the "Dolleton Crew").

rows.label: GLOSSARY_009_TITLE
rows.name: Lao

rows.label: GLOSSARY_009_PAGE01
rows.name:
A team leader belonging to paramilitary group BLADE, whose
battle chops and decision-making have caught even Elma's
attention. He and Doug were fellow soldiers in the U.S. army.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_010_TITLE
rows.name: Lao \[Declassified\]

rows.label: GLOSSARY_010_PAGE01
rows.name:
When he learned of the conspiracy behind Project Exodus
and found that his wife and child were unable to board the
White Whale, Lao was plunged into the depths of despair.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_010_PAGE02
rows.name:
Soon thereafter, he began working as a spy for the Growth,
aiding them in their mission to wipe humanity from existence.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_011_TITLE
rows.name: Lu

rows.label: GLOSSARY_011_PAGE01
rows.name:
Full name Lu Cirufe, Lu is a Miran native and prolific inventor.
He has long made a living by selling the products he designs
to the Nopon and other indigenous races.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_011_PAGE02
rows.name:
Brimming with curiosity, he welcomes humans with open arms.
For some reason, he also has a vast knowledge of idioms—
most of which he gets wrong.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_012_TITLE
rows.name: Nagi

rows.label: GLOSSARY_012_PAGE01
rows.name:
Former White Whale captain, now NLA defense secretary, Nagi
governs tirelessly to make life on Mira tolerable. He is also a
iaijutsu master—some say the best combatant in all of BLADE.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_013_TITLE
rows.name: Frye

rows.label: GLOSSARY_013_PAGE01
rows.name:
A BLADE operative from the Interceptors Union. The perilous
missions he takes have earned him the moniker "Killer Ostrich."
Often found at the local diner knocking back an off-duty drink.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_014_TITLE
rows.name: Phog Christoph

rows.label: GLOSSARY_014_PAGE01
rows.name:
A BLADE operative from the Landbankers Union. Phog has the
makings of a genius, but is quite shy and adheres to his own
rhythm. As such, he prefers to carry out assignments alone.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_015_TITLE
rows.name: Himeri Aranji

rows.label: GLOSSARY_015_PAGE01
rows.name:
A BLADE operative from the Companions Union. Hope is
revered throughout NLA for her selfless devotion to helping
citizens with their troubles.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_016_TITLE
rows.name: Murderess

rows.label: GLOSSARY_016_PAGE01
rows.name:
A BLADE operative from the Testamenters Union. Skilled though
she is, the Murderess would backstab anyone for a price.
No operative wants to team up with her if they can help it.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_017_TITLE
rows.name: Celica

rows.label: GLOSSARY_017_PAGE01
rows.name:
A kindhearted Qlurian who drifted to Mira along with Rock.
Celica's gentle demeanor and sense of responsibility drive her
to endlessly protect her counterpart from any kind of conflict.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_018_TITLE
rows.name: Rock

rows.label: GLOSSARY_018_PAGE01
rows.name:
A young Gaur male on the run from the Growth with Celica.
Though big and strong, Rock is very much a child and cannot
fight to defend himself. He thinks of Celica as an older sister.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_019_TITLE
rows.name: Miia

rows.label: GLOSSARY_019_PAGE01
rows.name:
A junior BLADE who is still learning the ropes, but has
managed to survive a number of trials with a touch of luck
and lots of tenacity.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_019_PAGE02
rows.name:
Her next goal is to be placed on the same team with
a particular operative she looks up to...

rows.label: GLOSSARY_020_TITLE
rows.name: Vandham

rows.label: GLOSSARY_020_PAGE01
rows.name:
Commander of paramilitary group BLADE, the big-hearted
Vandham's training regimes can be brutal, but Secretary
Nagi's trust and the respect BLADE affords him speak volumes.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_020_PAGE02
rows.name: Previously served as the White Whale's chief engineer.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_021_TITLE
rows.name: Maurice

rows.label: GLOSSARY_021_PAGE01
rows.name:
Former defense minister of the United States and later aide
to the president, Maurice Chausson leaned on the experience
he gained on Earth to name himself Director General of the

rows.label: GLOSSARY_021_PAGE02
rows.name:
newly-founded provisional government and become the
representative of humanity on planet Mira.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_022_TITLE
rows.name: H.B.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_022_PAGE01
rows.name:
A BLADE operative from the Pathfinders Union. Hector
Birtwhistle is a logical man armed with untiring ambition.
He has his sights set on the position of BLADE Commander,

rows.label: GLOSSARY_022_PAGE02
rows.name:
and therefore sees Vandham as his rival. His "rival," however,
has little interest in his provocations.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_023_TITLE
rows.name: Bozé Lowes

rows.label: GLOSSARY_023_PAGE01
rows.name:
A BLADE operative from the Avalanchers Union. Bozé is a veteran
soldier with a service record dating back to Coalition army
days. He went on to become a military-academy instructor,

rows.label: GLOSSARY_023_PAGE02
rows.name:
and trained many active BLADEs. Bozé is also deeply
interested in certain facets of eastern Earth culture.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_024_TITLE
rows.name: Yelv

rows.label: GLOSSARY_024_PAGE01
rows.name:
A BLADE operative from the Testamenters Union. Foul-mouthed
and quick-tempered, Yelv isn't a typical example of BLADE's
finest—though he will open his heart to those he respects.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_024_PAGE02
rows.name:
Similar to the protagonist, he has some issues with his
memories of past events.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_025_TITLE
rows.name: Axena

rows.label: GLOSSARY_025_PAGE01
rows.name:
A BLADE operative from the Arms Union, Axena primarily
engages in weapon testing for arms manufacturers.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_025_PAGE02
rows.name:
She loves machines and gadgets above all else, and is
happiest when in a Doll cockpit.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_029_TITLE
rows.name: Ga-Derg

rows.label: GLOSSARY_029_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Larsian mercenary who works for the Growth. During the
attack on NLA, he cut down BLADE forces by the dozen with
superlative martial prowess and took the Vita back by force.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_031_TITLE
rows.name: Ga Buidhe

rows.label: GLOSSARY_031_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Larsian who has served as Ga-Derg's right hand since
childhood, Ga Buidhe is a woman of few words who always
puts her prince first. A model deputy commander.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_033_TITLE
rows.name: Luxaar

rows.label: GLOSSARY_033_PAGE01
rows.name:
A xenoform who opposes humanity and Grandmaster of the
crime syndicate known as the Growth, Luxaar is driven by
a roiling hatred for all humans—and an equal measure of fear.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_034_TITLE
rows.name: Goetia

rows.label: GLOSSARY_034_PAGE01
rows.name:
A ruthless and bloodthirsty xenoform Growth commander.
Goetia destroyed the Lifepoint fragment which had landed in
the Nightglow Forest region,

rows.label: GLOSSARY_034_PAGE02
rows.name: thereafter engaging Elma's unit in battle.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_035_TITLE
rows.name: Ryyz

rows.label: GLOSSARY_035_PAGE01
rows.name:
A xenoform Growth commander who made an appearance
on the front line during the attack on NLA, posing an obstacle
to Elma and her team.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_035_PAGE02
rows.name: Ryyz is a quick-tempered and highly vindictive individual.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_036_TITLE
rows.name: Dagahn

rows.label: GLOSSARY_036_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Growth commander paired with Ryyz. Capable of
outclassing a Doll with his raw strength alone.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_039_TITLE
rows.name: Humans

rows.label: GLOSSARY_039_PAGE01
rows.name:
Homo sapiens. Originated from the third planet of their
native solar system, Earth.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_040_TITLE
rows.name: Nopon

rows.label: GLOSSARY_040_PAGE01
rows.name:
A peace-loving people, said to have lived on Mira since time
immemorial. Most Nopon belong to a collective known as
the Nopon Commerce Guild.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_040_PAGE02
rows.name:
They make their living by conducting business across the
diverse regions of Mira.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_041_TITLE
rows.name: Larsians

rows.label: GLOSSARY_041_PAGE01
rows.name:
A race from the Lars star system who possess powerful bodies
and exceptional martial ability. They were once hailed as a
great power—until a Growth plot brought them to their knees.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_041_PAGE02
rows.name:
Having lost their homeland, the Larsians were left with no
choice but to serve the Growth as mercenaries to ensure
their survival.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_043_TITLE
rows.name: Bias

rows.label: GLOSSARY_043_PAGE01
rows.name:
A race divided into two separate clans: the Tree Clan and
the Cavern Clan. Despite a long history of rivalry, both clans
remained evenly balanced, until one day the Cavern Clan

rows.label: GLOSSARY_043_PAGE02
rows.name:
tipped the scales by forming an alliance with the Growth.
As a result, the Tree Clan were ousted from their home.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_044_TITLE
rows.name: Definians

rows.label: GLOSSARY_044_PAGE01
rows.name:
A covert force working under the Growth. Their ability to
assume the forms of other creatures makes them excellently
suited for infiltration missions.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_045_TITLE
rows.name: Zaruboggan

rows.label: GLOSSARY_045_PAGE01
rows.name:
Hailing from planet Bedun, the Zaruboggan worship a being
known as Golbogga. The suits they wear allow them to adapt
to any environment, no matter how hostile.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_045_PAGE02
rows.name:
Curiously, they exist to—in their words—"devoltanize" the
areas of the world which have gone "voltant."

rows.label: GLOSSARY_046_TITLE
rows.name: Ma-non

rows.label: GLOSSARY_046_PAGE01
rows.name:
A race whose highly advanced technology differs from that
of Earth's. Stranded on Mira due to navigational trouble,
the Ma-non were consequently attacked by the Growth,

rows.label: GLOSSARY_046_PAGE02
rows.name:
at which point Elma's team stepped in to save them.
They are a highly inquisitive people—and they happen
to have a particular penchant for pizza.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_047_TITLE
rows.name: Orpheans

rows.label: GLOSSARY_047_PAGE01
rows.name:
An advanced race who worship the Ovah. Though different
in physiology from humans, Orpheans are known to be highly
intelligent. They deemed war an illogical concept long ago,

rows.label: GLOSSARY_047_PAGE02
rows.name:
and have since abandoned all thought of conflict. Their
technological capabilities are on par with the Ma-non.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_048_TITLE
rows.name: Gaur

rows.label: GLOSSARY_048_PAGE01
rows.name:
A race notable for their huge bodies, which match Dolls in size
and can exceed them in power. Their physique is intimidating
even when still adolescent, as is the case with Rock.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_049_TITLE
rows.name: Provisional Government

rows.label: GLOSSARY_049_PAGE01
rows.name:
After crash-landing on Mira, the Coalition government was
disbanded in favor of this new self-governing body, which now
runs NLA under Director General Chausson's leadership.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_050_TITLE
rows.name: BLADE

rows.label: GLOSSARY_050_PAGE01
rows.name:
A paramilitary group established to replace Coalition
government forces. The letters are an acronym for
"Beyond the Logos Artificial Destiny Emancipator."

rows.label: GLOSSARY_050_PAGE02
rows.name: The term was coined by Secretary Nagi.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_051_TITLE
rows.name: Dolleton Crew

rows.label: GLOSSARY_051_PAGE01
rows.name:
A more pithy name for the Special Operations Heavy Armor
Training Unit, an instructional entity from the Coalition
government era. Elma, Irina, Gwin, and Doug were all members.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_052_TITLE
rows.name: Unions

rows.label: GLOSSARY_052_PAGE01
rows.name:
The eight fields into which BLADE duties are classified.
BLADE's primary goals are to locate the Lifepoint, explore
Mira, and maintain order in NLA.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_052_PAGE02
rows.name:
The Union a BLADE member belongs to determines the exact
type of work they most commonly engage in.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_053_TITLE
rows.name: Pathfinders

rows.label: GLOSSARY_053_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Union with a focus on installing data probes and
expanding the FrontierNet network.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_054_TITLE
rows.name: Interceptors

rows.label: GLOSSARY_054_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Union tasked with culling indigens on Mira. They are also
hired in a secondary capacity to protect teams on expeditions,
guard VIPs, and rescue NLA citizens.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_055_TITLE
rows.name: Avalanchers

rows.label: GLOSSARY_055_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Union in charge of eliminating Overeds—indigens that pose
an extreme threat, even by Miran standards. If the Interceptors
are the defense, the Avalanchers are most certainly the offense.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_056_TITLE
rows.name: Testamenters

rows.label: GLOSSARY_056_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Union that seeks out and retrieves pieces of the White
Whale scattered around Mira. Also responsible for recovering
personal effects and materiel left behind after a battle.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_057_TITLE
rows.name: Collepedians

rows.label: GLOSSARY_057_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Union that scouts out unexplored territory on Mira,
bringing back whatever samples they are able to acquire.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_058_TITLE
rows.name: Landbankers

rows.label: GLOSSARY_058_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Union that provides the necessary amenities for the
people of NLA, seeking out minerals, resources, and more.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_059_TITLE
rows.name: Arms

rows.label: GLOSSARY_059_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Union designed to broadly assist arms manufacturers
however they can. This can range from general support to
testing prototype weaponry.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_060_TITLE
rows.name: Companions

rows.label: GLOSSARY_060_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Union whose primary duty is to resolve civilian disputes
in NLA, be it intervening in a quarrel or finding a lost cat.
The Companion must be ready to tackle almost anything.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_061_TITLE
rows.name: Arms Manufacturer

rows.label: GLOSSARY_061_PAGE01
rows.name:
A term which applies to any business that engages in the
development of Doll and ground gear weaponry.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_062_TITLE
rows.name: Sakuraba Industries

rows.label: GLOSSARY_062_PAGE01
rows.name:
Central pillar of the Sakuraba Group conglomerate.
Sakuraba firearms exhibit remarkable stability and accuracy,
qualities which exemplify the design ethos of their creators.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_063_TITLE
rows.name: Grenada Galactic Group

rows.label: GLOSSARY_063_PAGE01
rows.name:
This new AM is an avid investor in beam-tech research.
Its best sellers are weapons that emphasize quick cooldowns,
and protective wear that offers high beam resistance.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_064_TITLE
rows.name: Meredith & Co.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_064_PAGE01
rows.name:
An innovative user of Growth tech in the weapon-design field.
Its products have made waves for their ability to harness ether,
a feat which has hitherto proven difficult for human technology.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_065_TITLE
rows.name: Candid & Credible

rows.label: GLOSSARY_065_PAGE01
rows.name:
This Ma-non arms manufacturer specializes in solid
defensive gear, and is aiming to expand its market with its
lineup of bolt weapons.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_066_TITLE
rows.name: Orpheus Parfait

rows.label: GLOSSARY_066_PAGE01
rows.name:
An AM made up of Orpheans who defected from the Growth
to NLA. Their gear's architecture differs greatly from standard
human tech. High-evasion protective wear is their prime focus.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_067_TITLE
rows.name: Six Stars

rows.label: GLOSSARY_067_PAGE01
rows.name:
Branch office of a Larsian conglomerate that monopolized the
weapons market on its home planet. Its mainstay lineup boasts
high-power weapons, and armor with high physical resistance.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_068_TITLE
rows.name: Nopon Commerce Guild

rows.label: GLOSSARY_068_PAGE01
rows.name:
A commerce guild started by the enterprising Nopon. Most of
their products are thermal weapons that have been tuned to
deliver greater magazine capacity.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_069_TITLE
rows.name: Factory 1.21

rows.label: GLOSSARY_069_PAGE01
rows.name:
A privately-owned arms manufacturer known for the unique
aesthetics and singular craftsmanship of its custom-made
products. It has quickly built up a cult following of supporters.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_070_TITLE
rows.name: Samaar Federation

rows.label: GLOSSARY_070_PAGE01
rows.name:
An interstellar union whose reach extends across the vastness
of space in a six million light year radius. The Growth are but
a subset of it, leaving the federation's true scope unknown.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_071_TITLE
rows.name: Growth

rows.label: GLOSSARY_071_PAGE01
rows.name:
A criminal syndicate made up of a number of different
xenoforms. With Luxaar their appointed Grandmaster, their
tyranny knows no limits, seeking not just to erase humanity

rows.label: GLOSSARY_071_PAGE02
rows.name:
from existence, but also to subjugate other races and force
them into servitude.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_072_TITLE
rows.name: Growth (Artificial Lifeforms)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_072_PAGE01
rows.name:
Artificial lifeforms which the ancient Samaarians created to
do their bidding. Their bodies were implanted with a failsafe,
acting as an emergency "off" switch, should they turn violent.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_072_PAGE02
rows.name:
The key to that failsafe was the very DNA of humans,
the descendants of Samaar. In fear of this fact, the
Growth sought to erase all humans before they

rows.label: GLOSSARY_072_PAGE03
rows.name:
could leave their Blue Bloods and return to their original,
biological bodies.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_074_TITLE
rows.name: Doll

rows.label: GLOSSARY_074_PAGE01
rows.name:
Capable of fully shifting between humanoid combat mode and
vehicular cruise mode, these mobile weapons can be fitted with
different equipment for a wide variety of combat applications.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_074_PAGE02
rows.name:
Initially developed following a prediction that the Earth would
one day need to defend itself against extraterrestrial threats,
Dolls also greatly contributed to the restoration of NLA.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_075_TITLE
rows.name: Flight Module

rows.label: GLOSSARY_075_PAGE01
rows.name:
A module developed by Lin, which enables Dolls to fly.
Seeking to complete her parents' research, she gained the
support of the Ma-non and Sakuraba Industries and,

rows.label: GLOSSARY_075_PAGE02
rows.name:
after much tweaking and tinkering, at last succeeded
in bringing the project to fruition.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_076_TITLE
rows.name: White Whale

rows.label: GLOSSARY_076_PAGE01
rows.name:
The nickname for Earth escape vessel L-002. Though able to
depart Earth two years ago, the ship was later damaged in
an alien attack and eventually became grounded on Mira.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_077_TITLE
rows.name: Lifepoint

rows.label: GLOSSARY_077_PAGE01
rows.name:
The facility in which all of humanity is believed to lie sleeping.
When the White Whale fell, pieces of the Lifepoint broke off from
the ship, raining down across Mira.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_077_PAGE02
rows.name:
In addition to housing human bodies, the units also contain
various databases which store precious data, such as literary
records from back on Earth.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_078_TITLE
rows.name: FrontierNet

rows.label: GLOSSARY_078_PAGE01
rows.name:
Conceived as a modular exploration system for uncharted
planets, the FrontierNet system allows information to be
relayed through data probes installed across Mira to NLA.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_078_PAGE02
rows.name:
Expanding the FrontierNet network is one of BLADE's primary
objectives, as it both helps toward maintaining a stable life on
Mira, and is indispensable for locating Lifepoint Units.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_079_TITLE
rows.name: Segment

rows.label: GLOSSARY_079_PAGE01
rows.name:
On the FrontierNet network, a "segment" refers to a bounded
block used to identify Mira's topographical features.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_080_TITLE
rows.name: Data Probe

rows.label: GLOSSARY_080_PAGE01
rows.name:
A device used to relay information about Mira to the
FrontierNet system. To install one, it must be firmly planted
in the ground.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_081_TITLE
rows.name: Navigation Ball

rows.label: GLOSSARY_081_PAGE01
rows.name:
A "super-secret must-have Nopon item." Guides you if you lose
your way, but it apparently doesn't always work as intended.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_082_TITLE
rows.name: IFF

rows.label: GLOSSARY_082_PAGE01
rows.name:
Short for "Identification, Friend or Foe." As the name
suggests, this device is able to discern between hostile
and friendly entities.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_083_TITLE
rows.name: Blue Blood

rows.label: GLOSSARY_083_PAGE01
rows.name:
Blue Bloods, or "B.B." for short, are artificial bodies tougher
than that of a human's, which can be operated remotely from
one's biological body even as it sleeps in the Lifepoint.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_084_TITLE
rows.name: Overclock

rows.label: GLOSSARY_084_PAGE01
rows.name:
A new combat ability that humanity acquired along with their
Blue Blood form. A similar system has been incorporated into
Doll architecture.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_085_TITLE
rows.name: Bioplasma

rows.label: GLOSSARY_085_PAGE01
rows.name:
The name of the bluish liquid that flows through Blue Blood
bodies. If it leaks, the B.B. will suffer from greatly reduced
functions—worst case, it could become completely inoperable.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_086_TITLE
rows.name: Trion Barrier

rows.label: GLOSSARY_086_PAGE01
rows.name:
An energy wall deployed as part of the Central Life's
automatic defense system. Allegedly, it is not in fact
human technology, but Qlurian in origin.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_087_TITLE
rows.name: Quantum Mainframe

rows.label: GLOSSARY_087_PAGE01
rows.name:
The center of the Central Life, and the most technologically
advanced computer humanity has ever created, in terms of
both speed and capacity. It houses the memories and genetic

rows.label: GLOSSARY_087_PAGE02
rows.name:
makeup of the 20 million humans who escaped the Earth
as part of Project Exodus. The data is stored away digitally,
inside the Core.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_088_TITLE
rows.name: Protoplasmic Fluid

rows.label: GLOSSARY_088_PAGE01
rows.name:
A microbial solution that allows bodily structures to be
replicated from the genetic data stored in the Central Life.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_089_TITLE
rows.name: Prog Ares

rows.label: GLOSSARY_089_PAGE01
rows.name:
A new experimental model of Doll developed by BLADE,
which Lao illicitly commandeered.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_091_TITLE
rows.name: Almandal

rows.label: GLOSSARY_091_PAGE01
rows.name:
Goetia's blindingly nimble craft, built to combat alien Dolls.
Though its high mobility is optimized for close-quarters combat,
its tail-mounted drones allow for ranged attacks as well.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_092_TITLE
rows.name: Zu Pharg

rows.label: GLOSSARY_092_PAGE01
rows.name:
The Growth's largest transforming Doll. In disc form,
the Zu Pharg can bend gravity to fly. Besides a deadly main cannon,
it also houses a massive charged particle cannon in its head.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_092_PAGE02
rows.name:
To top it off, the powerful anti-materiel Gungnir cannon in
its tail showcases that the Zu Pharg was built primarily to
annihilate enemy strongholds. Piloted by Ryyz and Dagahn.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_093_TITLE
rows.name: Vita

rows.label: GLOSSARY_093_PAGE01
rows.name:
The ultimate Doll, created with technology unknown to both
human and Growth. The body is composed of dark matter,
which the craft absorbs from its surroundings, far exceeding

rows.label: GLOSSARY_093_PAGE02
rows.name:
the output of any human-made Doll. Manned by Luxaar—
yet the craft's true master is a mysterious figure known only
as "the Great One."

rows.label: GLOSSARY_096_TITLE
rows.name: Mira

rows.label: GLOSSARY_096_PAGE01
rows.name:
An unknown planet not located on any starchart, now home
to the survivors of Earth. Mira was named after a certain
woman who devoted her life to the success of Project Exodus,

rows.label: GLOSSARY_096_PAGE02
rows.name: choosing in the end to join Earth in its ultimate fate.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_097_TITLE
rows.name: Earth

rows.label: GLOSSARY_097_PAGE01
rows.name:
Third planet in humanity's native solar system. The Earth
was caught up in a battle between opposing alien forces
two years ago, and subsequently destroyed.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_098_TITLE
rows.name: NLA

rows.label: GLOSSARY_098_PAGE01
rows.name:
The White Whale's residential unit, known as the Habitat,
which broke off from the vessel. Commonly called New Los
Angeles, after the city on which it was modeled.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_099_TITLE
rows.name: BLADE Home

rows.label: GLOSSARY_099_PAGE01
rows.name:
A living space exclusively for BLADE operatives,
situated behind BLADE Tower.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_100_TITLE
rows.name: Industrial Area

rows.label: GLOSSARY_100_PAGE01
rows.name:
A district containing industrial facilities such as those related
to food production, as well as weapon and Doll development.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_101_TITLE
rows.name: Commercial Area

rows.label: GLOSSARY_101_PAGE01
rows.name:
NLA's sole "downtown" district, populated with restaurants,
galleries, cafés, clothing and grocery stores, and more.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_102_TITLE
rows.name: Residential Area

rows.label: GLOSSARY_102_PAGE01
rows.name:
A district which provides housing for the people of NLA.
Includes a park, cathedral, and other common amenities.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_103_TITLE
rows.name: BLADE Area

rows.label: GLOSSARY_103_PAGE01
rows.name:
The nerve center at the heart of NLA, this district holds the
administrative tower, home to BLADE HQ and the government,
as well as Armory Alley and the BLADE Home.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_104_TITLE
rows.name: Primordial Wilderness

rows.label: GLOSSARY_104_PAGE01
rows.name:
One of Mira's continents. Many of the units which constituted
the White Whale landed here. Named thusly because it was
the first place on Mira upon which humanity set foot.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_105_TITLE
rows.name: Nightglow Forest

rows.label: GLOSSARY_105_PAGE01
rows.name:
A densely forested region to the west of Primordial Wilderness.
The abundance of bioluminescent plant life illuminates
the land come nightfall, hence the name.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_106_TITLE
rows.name: Valley of Oblivion

rows.label: GLOSSARY_106_PAGE01
rows.name:
A rocky, rugged region to the east of Primordial Wilderness. What appears
to be multiple relics from an ancient alien civilization have
been sighted there, but whatever intelligent lifeforms might

rows.label: GLOSSARY_106_PAGE02
rows.name:
once have created them are long gone, their work lost to
the sands of oblivion.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_107_TITLE
rows.name: White Woods

rows.label: GLOSSARY_107_PAGE01
rows.name:
Situated north of Primordial Wilderness, White Woods is an otherworldly region
carpeted in white sand, its landscape dotted with twisting
outcrops and eerie structures—a "luminous forest," as it were.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_108_TITLE
rows.name: Cauldros

rows.label: GLOSSARY_108_PAGE01
rows.name:
Found to the north of White Woods, this hotbed of volcanic
activity flows with scorching lava—yet numerous ruins
of some ancient alien civilization still stand.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_110_TITLE
rows.name: Lifepoint Unit

rows.label: GLOSSARY_110_PAGE01
rows.name:
A piece of the Lifepoint that fell away from the White Whale
as it crashed down. Seeking out these units is one of BLADE's
primary objectives.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_111_TITLE
rows.name: Blue Blood Maintenance Center

rows.label: GLOSSARY_111_PAGE01
rows.name:
A facility for maintaining and repairing Blue Bloods.
So long as the core is intact, lost limbs can be replaced
as needed to restore the B.B. to working order.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_112_TITLE
rows.name: BLADE Tower

rows.label: GLOSSARY_112_PAGE01
rows.name: The nerve center of NLA, housing BLADE HQ.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_113_TITLE
rows.name: Central Life

rows.label: GLOSSARY_113_PAGE01
rows.name:
The Lifepoint's central unit, where human bodies are stored.
Even if someone loses their Blue Blood body, it's possible
to switch to a new one, but the Central Life is the only place

rows.label: GLOSSARY_113_PAGE02
rows.name: in which the reset process can be initiated.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_114_TITLE
rows.name: Central Life \[Declassified\]

rows.label: GLOSSARY_114_PAGE01
rows.name:
Human bodies were not in fact stored within the Central Life.
The truth is that humans' consciousness had been uploaded
to a quantum mainframe.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_114_PAGE02
rows.name:
The database that should have stored their consciousness,
however, was found to have been destroyed, and had ceased
functioning even before the White Whale crashed on Mira.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_115_TITLE
rows.name: ECP (Project Exodus)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_115_PAGE01
rows.name:
The Earthlife Colonization Project, or Project Exodus, was a
plan to use interstellar ships to leave Earth and set out into
space in search of a habitable planet.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_116_TITLE
rows.name: Project Exodus \[Declassified\]

rows.label: GLOSSARY_116_PAGE01
rows.name:
The real form that Project Exodus took was to send out arks
carrying banks of genetic data of all life on Earth, so that
they might someday flourish again on another world.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_116_PAGE02
rows.name:
The Blue Bloods would escort this system to a safe new
home to lay the foundations of a new society and, using the
stored genetic data, effectively "reboot" humanity—and indeed

rows.label: GLOSSARY_116_PAGE03
rows.name: all of Earth's living organisms.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_117_TITLE
rows.name: Doll License

rows.label: GLOSSARY_117_PAGE01
rows.name:
A license which permits a person to pilot a Doll. Given that
a Doll could become a heinous weapon in the wrong hands,
BLADE HQ has stringent measures put in place, requiring

rows.label: GLOSSARY_117_PAGE02
rows.name: applicants to first pass a rigorous evaluation process.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_118_TITLE
rows.name: BLADE Tower Readout

rows.label: GLOSSARY_118_PAGE01
rows.name:
The display on BLADE Tower counts down the remaining
time before the Lifepoint loses power. Should it hit zero, the
human bodies frozen in cold sleep would be as good as dead.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_119_TITLE
rows.name: Telethia

rows.label: GLOSSARY_119_PAGE01
rows.name:
Said to be Mira's guardian and culler of unclean lifeforms,
the Telethia is also known as the "Ruler of Fates." Rumored
to have mind-reading abilities.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_119_PAGE02
rows.name:
The creature's vast wings also have the ability to amplify
and manipulate ether in the surrounding atmosphere.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_120_TITLE
rows.name: Praedo

rows.label: GLOSSARY_120_PAGE01
rows.name:
Abnormal variants of common creatures found only in certain
parts of Nightglow Forest. They attack and devour anything, save for
other tainted creatures—and B.B., which are inorganic.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_121_TITLE
rows.name: Overed

rows.label: GLOSSARY_121_PAGE01
rows.name:
A designation for any indigenous lifeform that poses a special
threat. Even some of BLADE's very best teams have returned
with serious injuries after encountering an Overed in the field...

rows.label: GLOSSARY_122_TITLE
rows.name: Samaar (Race)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_122_PAGE01
rows.name:
A race that arrived from another plane at the dawn of the
cosmos, from which humans and Elma's race are descended.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_130_TITLE
rows.name: Prologue Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_130_PAGE01
rows.name:
Two years after taking to the stars, the interstellar vessel
known as the White Whale was attacked by alien aggressors,
crash landing on an uncharted planet. Two months later,

rows.label: GLOSSARY_130_PAGE02
rows.name:
a human who escaped during the crash was rescued at
Meteor Valley, awakened from sleep by a woman named Elma.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_131_TITLE
rows.name: Prologue Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_131_PAGE01
rows.name:
Elma and [ST:playername ] took out some dangerous
indigens en route, and soon arrived at the Habitat unit
that detached from the White Whale: New Los Angeles.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_131_PAGE02
rows.name:
Mira—this was the name given to the planet that would be
humanity's new home.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_132_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 1 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_132_PAGE01
rows.name:
Having arrived back in NLA, Elma and [ST:playername ]
headed for the administrative district, which would serve as
their area of residence from that point on.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_133_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 1 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_133_PAGE01
rows.name:
Elma's team met with Lin, and [ST:playername ] was given
a general introduction to BLADE—a paramilitary group
established alongside the provisional government.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_133_PAGE02
rows.name:
Upon learning its purpose, [ST:playername ]
mulls over the idea of enlisting.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_134_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 2 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_134_PAGE01
rows.name:
Having chosen to join BLADE, [ST:playername ] is given
their first mission: installing a data probe.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_134_PAGE02
rows.name:
Elma's team sets out for the placement site,
situated in Primordial Wilderness.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_135_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 2 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_135_PAGE01
rows.name:
[ST:playername ] successfully planted the data probe at
the designated FrontierNet probe placement site.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_135_PAGE02
rows.name:
They returned to BLADE HQ, whereupon they became
acquainted with BLADE's commander, Vandham.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_136_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 3 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_136_PAGE01
rows.name:
After picking a Union, [ST:playername ] is given a new
assignment: to assist Elma in locating Nelson's team, whose
signal fell silent somewhere in Primordial Wilderness.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_137_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 3 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_137_PAGE01
rows.name:
During their mission, Elma's team encountered some Bias,
xenos with a fierce antipathy toward humans who had
butchered Nelson's entire team.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_137_PAGE02
rows.name:
By chance, they also stumbled upon a young Nopon
named Tatsu in need of assistance. Vandham asked the team
to look after him—and so a new friendship was born.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_138_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 4 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_138_PAGE01
rows.name:
Vandham informed Elma's team of a signal coming from
Nightglow Forest that appeared to originate from a piece of the
Lifepoint.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_138_PAGE02
rows.name:
To get the search underway, the party sets out to meet Lao,
who is currently installing data probes in the area.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_139_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 4 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_139_PAGE01
rows.name:
With Lu Cirufe's guidance, Elma's team arrived at the Lifepoint Unit,
only to see it destroyed at the hands of Goetia and her Bias
lackeys. Fortunately, it was just an Archive unit that they had

rows.label: GLOSSARY_139_PAGE02
rows.name:
blown up and not the Core itself, but with this new and present
threat from the Growth syndicate made clear, the search for
the Lifepoint is now more urgent than ever.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_140_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 5 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_140_PAGE01
rows.name:
With Irina and Gwin away on a different mission, Elma's team
has been left to pick up the slack.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_140_PAGE02
rows.name:
They head out to Valley of Oblivion to examine a xenoform craft that
the Growth purportedly attacked.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_141_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 5 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_141_PAGE01
rows.name:
Elma's team was able to fend off the Growth and extract
the Ma-non, but not before [ST:playername ] lost an arm.
In a surprising turn of events, the arm turned out to be robotic.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_141_PAGE02
rows.name:
[ST:playername ] then learned that the entire crew of the
White Whale had artificial bodies called Blue Bloods, and
that their real bodies were being held in the Central Life,

rows.label: GLOSSARY_141_PAGE03
rows.name:
which would lose power when the counter on BLADE Tower
reached zero. If they didn't find the Lifepoint in time, humanity
would perish—this was the reason for their desperation.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_142_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 6 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_142_PAGE01
rows.name:
Elma's team have been tasked with retrieving a mech of
alien origin, abandoned deep in the heart of Nightglow Forest.
There's just one problem—it lies in a den of Praedo indigens

rows.label: GLOSSARY_142_PAGE02
rows.name:
who devour anything that breathes. The team set out
regardless, trusting that their inorganic B.B. will grant
them safe passage.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_143_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 6 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_143_PAGE01
rows.name:
You successfully retrieved the alien mech, but many of its
parts were anomalous, making it difficult to fully identify.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_143_PAGE02
rows.name:
Meanwhile, Grandmaster Luxaar, leader of the Growth,
began plotting his next move...

rows.label: GLOSSARY_144_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 7 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_144_PAGE01
rows.name:
A piece of the Lifepoint has been found in Valley of Oblivion. It's not the
Central Life, but Irina and her team were sent to investigate
and have been reportedly caught in a Growth ambush.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_144_PAGE02
rows.name: Elma's team moves out.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_145_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 7 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_145_PAGE01
rows.name:
The attack had been orchestrated by Growth commander
Goetia, who had used the Lifepoint Unit as a lure to lead
humans into a trap when they came looking.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_145_PAGE02
rows.name:
Elma's team were able to defeat Goetia, but for some reason,
the Growth seemed to know that the Central Life's power
was going to run out.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_145_PAGE03
rows.name:
It was clear that something even deeper-rooted than hatred
compelled the Growth's animosity toward humans.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_146_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 8 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_146_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Union of Growth forces have suddenly begun marching
on NLA. Elma's team takes up position at the entrance to the
administrative district.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_147_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 8 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_147_PAGE01
rows.name:
BLADE forces successfully repelled the Growth's attack
and saved NLA—though not without great sacrifice. The
Growth's real objective, however, was to take back the

rows.label: GLOSSARY_147_PAGE02
rows.name:
alien Doll that had been recovered in Nightglow Forest. How could
they have known that humans had brought it back, and the
exact location in which it was kept?

rows.label: GLOSSARY_147_PAGE03
rows.name: A possibility flickers across Elma's mind...

rows.label: GLOSSARY_148_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 9 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_148_PAGE01
rows.name:
Another piece of the Lifepoint has been found on the continent
of White Woods, situated to the north of NLA.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_148_PAGE02
rows.name:
As the designated survey team, Elma's unit heads out to the
site to rendezvous with Lao's advance party.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_149_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 9 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_149_PAGE01
rows.name:
Not only was there no Lifepoint, but the Growth had Larsian
mercenaries lying in wait. A hard-fought battle against their
leader, Ga-Derg, apparently satisfied him, as he divulged

rows.label: GLOSSARY_149_PAGE02
rows.name:
to Elma's team some valuable information: the location of
the Growth headquarters. He claimed that they lie to the
north of White Woods in a "shadowy land of rock and fire."

rows.label: GLOSSARY_149_PAGE03
rows.name:
The teams returned to NLA with an injured Lao in tow. First the
stolen Vita, now an ambush—it was all too pat. Elma begins to
suspect an informant—and that it might actually be Lao...

rows.label: GLOSSARY_150_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 10 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_150_PAGE01
rows.name:
Having combed the scene of the ambush, the Pathfinders found
clear signs of FrontierNet data being tampered with. It was
now evident there was a mole in BLADE's ranks.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_150_PAGE02
rows.name:
Elma's team receives a new assignment to repair
a data probe in White Woods.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_151_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 10 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_151_PAGE01
rows.name:
Elma's team arrived only to be attacked by the Zu Pharg,
an enormous flying disc manned by Ryyz and Dagahn.
They successfully defeated the dreadnought, but time was

rows.label: GLOSSARY_151_PAGE02
rows.name:
wearing thin. They had to find the Central Life and return
to their own bodies ASAP if they were to stand a chance of
defeating the Growth.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_152_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 11 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_152_PAGE01
rows.name:
Seizing the data terminal calculating the Central Life's
coordinates, Lao flees NLA, outing himself as the Growth spy.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_152_PAGE02
rows.name: Elma's team races after him to the Growth HQ in Cauldros.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_153_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 11 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_153_PAGE01
rows.name:
Lao revealed that he had assisted the Growth in their plot
to eradicate humanity because of rage and despair at the
deceit and corruption underpinning Project Exodus.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_153_PAGE02
rows.name:
Nevertheless, after his defeat, he claimed to have changed
his mind, and handed the data terminal to Lin. They left Lao
where he lay, returning to NLA to analyze the data ASAP.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_154_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 12 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_154_PAGE01
rows.name:
With the location of the Central Life revealed at last, all
available BLADE operatives are issued the order to sortie.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_154_PAGE02
rows.name:
As the Growth storm the Central Life, the battle for the
fate of humanity begins...

rows.label: GLOSSARY_155_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 12 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_155_PAGE01
rows.name:
With Luxaar defeated, BLADE forces safely secured the
Central Life and activated its auxiliary power system.
Elma then revealed her true identity, and the truth behind

rows.label: GLOSSARY_155_PAGE02
rows.name:
Project Exodus. Later, Elma headed to the database chamber
where humanity's consciousness was stored, only to find that
it had stopped functioning long before they had ever arrived

rows.label: GLOSSARY_155_PAGE03
rows.name:
on Mira. The system was a shambles and no trace of their
consciousness or memories remained. And yet the B.B.
were still operating. There was something about this planet...

rows.label: GLOSSARY_032_TITLE
rows.name: Al

rows.label: GLOSSARY_032_PAGE01
rows.name:
Pilot of the Ares and hero who saved the White Whale,
Al was declared M.I.A. after the crash-landing on Mira,
but miraculously returned from the rift between worlds.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_037_TITLE
rows.name: Void

rows.label: GLOSSARY_037_PAGE01
rows.name:
A primordial entity, creator of the Ares Prime and ringleader
of the Growth. He gathered together the Growth remnants
across Mira and proceeded to challenge humanity to a battle

rows.label: GLOSSARY_037_PAGE02
rows.name: which would determine their survival.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_038_TITLE
rows.name: Void (Samaarian)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_038_PAGE01
rows.name:
Born long ago as a citizen of Samaar, Void studied the
"ultimate matter"—the Conduit—and with it crafted the Ares.
But in doing so, he awakened the Ghosts and, as punishment,

rows.label: GLOSSARY_038_PAGE02
rows.name: was confined by other Samaarians in the rift between worlds.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_073_TITLE
rows.name: Ghosts

rows.label: GLOSSARY_073_PAGE01
rows.name:
A unknown enemy force that manifests itself wherever
dematerialization occurs. Present at both the destruction of
Earth and of Elma's homeworld, they are harbingers of ruin.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_073_PAGE02
rows.name:
According to Elma, Ghosts have no apparent will of their own,
and are, in essence, the universe's corrective system.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_090_TITLE
rows.name: Ares

rows.label: GLOSSARY_090_PAGE01
rows.name:
The first Doll, bestowed upon Earth by Elma. The Ares's
technology changed the way humans understood science,
arming them with a way to fight the Growth.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_090_PAGE02
rows.name:
Furthermore, the Ares was not created by Elma and her
people, but merely recreated based on records and relics
from ancient Samaar.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_094_TITLE
rows.name: Vita (Void)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_094_PAGE01
rows.name:
The Vita serves to sustain Void in material form, acting
as a vessel to manifest him in this universe even as he
remained trapped in the rift between worlds.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_095_TITLE
rows.name: White Whale 2

rows.label: GLOSSARY_095_PAGE01
rows.name:
A new escape vessel built to enact a second Project Exodus
by incorporating the Ares's jump drive into the Ma-non
mothership, the only thing large enough to carry all races.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_109_TITLE
rows.name: Volitaris

rows.label: GLOSSARY_109_PAGE01
rows.name:
An airborne continent which emerged in the skies above Mira
at the same time Void did. Reminiscent of a rocky reef, ancient
Samaarian relics still rest upon its fragmented floating islands.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_123_TITLE
rows.name: Dematerialization

rows.label: GLOSSARY_123_PAGE01
rows.name:
A phenomenon that occurred spontaneously all across
Mira, erasing any and all matter caught in its radius,
silencing even electromagnetic waves.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_124_TITLE
rows.name: Rift Between Worlds

rows.label: GLOSSARY_124_PAGE01
rows.name:
A special space that exists between parallel dimensions.
According to Al, who named the place, it feels like the
"backstage of space."

rows.label: GLOSSARY_125_TITLE
rows.name: Parallel Dimensions

rows.label: GLOSSARY_125_PAGE01
rows.name:
Countless dimensions which exist outside of the one we inhabit.
Their existence was proven through the analysis of the mystery
packets of data that the Ares received while in the Rift.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_126_TITLE
rows.name: The Second Project Exodus

rows.label: GLOSSARY_126_PAGE01
rows.name:
A plan to escape Mira before dematerialization consumes
it all by engaging the White Whale 2's jump drive and warping
to a new universe.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_127_TITLE
rows.name: Ares's Cores

rows.label: GLOSSARY_127_PAGE01
rows.name:
Six cores installed in the Ares, which command levels of energy
vast enough to bend space-time. As such, they are able to
warp a given object into another universe.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_128_TITLE
rows.name: Ares's Cores \[Declassified\]

rows.label: GLOSSARY_128_PAGE01
rows.name:
Ares's Cores were the product of Void's research, formed by
resolving the power of the ultimate matter, dubbed the Conduit,
into its component elements.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_129_TITLE
rows.name: Shackles of Samaar

rows.label: GLOSSARY_129_PAGE01
rows.name:
Giant spear-like restraining mechanisms created by the
ancient Samaarians, which serve to bind Void's power.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_156_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 13, Act 1 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_156_PAGE01
rows.name:
Hardly any time had passed since the Central Life
incident, when a new threat known as dematerialization
reared its head.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_156_PAGE02
rows.name:
Elma's team races to understand the nature of this
phenomenon as it expands, engulfing everything in its path.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_157_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 13, Act 1 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_157_PAGE01
rows.name:
From the Ghosts that appeared with the dematerialization,
to the Vita's assault and the return of the hero, Alois Bernholt,
BLADE have their work cut out for them.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_157_PAGE02
rows.name:
And as a mysterious entity named Void declares "a contest
in which survival is the prize," the wheel begins to turn once
again as humanity is pushed to the brink.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_158_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 13, Act 2 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_158_PAGE01
rows.name:
De-mat events, Ghosts, Growth remnants... With all manner
of threats in full view, a second Project Exodus is put into
motion: to reclaim the cores Void stole and jump from Mira

rows.label: GLOSSARY_158_PAGE02
rows.name:
to another world. With Elma at the helm, all BLADE personnel
set about assisting the construction of an escape vessel and
supporting any xenoforms that would be willing to move to NLA.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_159_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 13, Act 2 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_159_PAGE01
rows.name:
With the co-operation of the Ma-non and other xenoforms, at
last the new escape vessel—the White Whale 2—is complete,
as is the relocation of all willing sentient races.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_159_PAGE02
rows.name: The plan enters its final stage.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_160_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 13, Act 3 Summary (1/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_160_PAGE01
rows.name:
More Ghosts manifest as dematerialization hits NLA,
prompting the immediate launch of the White Whale 2,
which must now enact a daring escape.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_160_PAGE02
rows.name:
Elma and her troops engage the approaching Ghost swarms
to keep the White Whale 2 and evacuees safe.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_161_TITLE
rows.name: Chapter 13, Act 3 Summary (2/2)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_161_PAGE01
rows.name:
With the Ares's cores recovered and Void no more, the
survivors engage the jump drive and depart the universe in
its final throes. What awaits them in the next one?

rows.label: GLOSSARY_026_TITLE
rows.name: Neil-Nail

rows.label: GLOSSARY_026_PAGE01
rows.name:
A Qlurian archaeologist studying xenoform civilizations.
Her warm, affable nature makes her easy to get along with.
As a scholar, she is curious to learn about human customs.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_027_TITLE
rows.name: Neil-Nail (High Custodian)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_027_PAGE01
rows.name:
The High Custodian, who sits at the top of the Qlurian social
hierarchy. Tasked with investigating and—if it be deemed
necessary—destroying the remnants of alien civilizations that

rows.label: GLOSSARY_027_PAGE02
rows.name:
once received the gift of her Qlurian ancestors'
hyper-advanced technology.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_028_TITLE
rows.name: Liesel

rows.label: GLOSSARY_028_PAGE01
rows.name:
A test pilot hired by an arms manufacturer, Liesel was
involved in the development of Hraesvelg, a new Doll.
Once a member of the German air force, she has something

rows.label: GLOSSARY_028_PAGE02
rows.name:
of an abrasive side to her—but behind it lies a warm and
caring personality.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_030_TITLE
rows.name: Ga-Derg (Allied)

rows.label: GLOSSARY_030_PAGE01
rows.name:
Leader of the Larsian mercenaries and former prince,
Ga-Derg rejected the Growth to side with humans.
A believer in loyalty and honor and a true warrior, whose

rows.label: GLOSSARY_030_PAGE02
rows.name: virtues impress his people and his second, Ga Buidhe.

rows.label: GLOSSARY_042_TITLE
rows.name: Qlurians

rows.label: GLOSSARY_042_PAGE01
rows.name:
Hailing from the Qlu system, the Qlurians—or Qlu—are a highly
scientifically advanced civilization and devout worshippers of
ancient Samaar. Nowadays, they are a sequestered society,

rows.label: GLOSSARY_042_PAGE02
rows.name:
and are rarely found to interact with other star systems.
The Qlu are grown in artificial womb plants and birthed
in a very impersonal manner.
